definition: hidden details/dirty tricks/dark secrets
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
black/dark/sinister/secret/shady/illegal/to hide (sth) away/to vilify/(loanword) to hack (computing)
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
old variant of 幕[mu4]/curtain/screen

sentences.english: Just, the sorrow of parting was camouflaged by the dark night at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 只是，那时夜晚的黑幕遮蔽了离别的哀愁。

sentences.english: From the storm, the long calm, the darkness, the swell.
sentences.chinese: 暴风骤，长雨歇，黑幕随，膨离。

sentences.english: It is said that he died clutching the script to 'The Final Curtain'.
sentences.chinese: 据说，他临死前紧紧抓着《黑幕风云》的剧本。

sentences.english: The oldest magician make it by dropping a cold drape of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 幸好那位长命不老的魔法师拉下了一块凉爽的黑幕。

sentences.english: However, he has dared to bring to the public dark realities of war.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他敢于给公众带来关于战争黑幕的消息。

definition: covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
inside story/non-public information/behind the scenes/internal
unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
see 暗箱操作[an4 xiang1 cao1 zuo4]
to uncover (mistakes, corruption etc)/whistle-blowing
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
public opinion
a haze of doubts and suspicions
to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
to denounce/to condemn
disturbance/crisis/disputes/restlessness/CL:場|场[chang2]
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
(slang) (lit.) to tear cunt/(fig.) (of females) to have a catfight/to have a bitch fight
to start a rumor
